## Overview
In this project, I show an example of using Plotly. For this, I chose Iris data set and I will show a scatter 3D plot where X-Axis will be the column “Sepal.Length”, Y-Axis the column “Sepal.Width”, Z-Axis the column “Petal.Width", the dots´ size will be based on the column “Petal.Length”  and the dots’ colors will represente the Species.

```{r, message=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
#Loading Dataset
data("iris")
head(iris,2)
```

## Iris Plot
```{r, message=FALSE, echo=TRUE, warning= FALSE, fig.align='center'}
library(plotly)
plot_ly(iris, x = ~Sepal.Length, y = ~Sepal.Width, z=~Petal.Width,
        type = "scatter3d", mode = "markers", size=~Petal.Length, 
        color=~Species)
```
